newsitem.title: INDIA: Gates says India potential "software superpower".
newsitem.headline: Gates says India potential "software superpower".

text.p: Microsoft Corp chairman Bill Gates was quoted on Wednesday as saying India could become a global software superpower and was a more attractive investment target for his firm than China.

"India has the momentum to become a software superpower. It has the necessary potential. All that India needs is a few examples of successful companies," Gates said in an interview published in the Economic Times.

"The importance of India as a software country and a place we've decided to invest in is greater than China. I am impressed with the talent India has. The world can draw from this enormous pool of talent," he said.

Gates, who has won front-page headlines during his four-day visit that began on Monday, said he was impressed by India's success in halting software piracy and by government efforts to encourage the growth of information technology.

"My trip is a milestone in terms of my understanding of what kind of partnerships we can have (with India), where the market is, and I think we are getting quite a warm reception," Gates told the daily.
The 41-year-old Microsoft chief said he was optimistic that the firm would develop "talking computers" within the next five years.
"It's an area (in which) we have done a lot of advanced research. We have the higher speed chips that are extremely helpful. The thing that's tough is that speech is somewhat ambiguous," he said.

Gates, one of the richest men in the world with a 25 percent stake in Microsoft estimated at some $23 billion, said computer-induced changes had profoundly changed the way people think about education, democracy and markets.

"It's a sort of ultimate tool of capitalism -- to be able to reach out to see everybody who wants to sell a product or services, everybody who wants to buy that product or services, and let them collaborate," he said.
Gates was due to launch a new product and address a seminar in Bombay on Wednesday.
